WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Mrs. William C.

Address: N.W.T.

Birthplace: Airdrie, Alberta, Scotland

1. INDUSTRY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1947

Where did you set up housekeeping? Brandon, Manitoba

Where had you been living before that? Edmonton, Alberta

For how many people did you prepare meals? 4

How far was it to your nearest store? 3 miles

How often could a visit be made to the store? Every 2 weeks

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Just what we needed.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Hardat Queen

In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? 1.25 cents

How much did you use Graham flour? 100 lbs

Whole wheat flour? 100 lbs

Was flour milled locally? Yes

How far away? 75 miles

What year? 1947

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? About 75 cents

What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal

Cornmeal? Yes

Whole wheat? No

Farina? No

Other? No

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes

How did you grind it? With an ordinary feed grinder

Put through twice made good flour, rather course though.
1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start homesteading in Montana County? (1879)

Where did you get your homestead? (Montana County)

Have you been living there before that? (Yes)

For how many years have you been living there? (25 years)

How far was it to your nearest store? (About 10 miles)

How often could you visit by foot to the store? (Once a week)

What groceries did you usually buy at those earliest years? (Grain, salt, sugar)

2. FLOUR AND GRAIN

What brand of wheat flour did you use in the early years? (Montana County)

In what quantity did you buy it? (100 lbs.)

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of wheat flour? ($1.25)

How much did you use per month? (100 lbs.)

Was flour milled locally? (Yes)

How far away? (About 10 miles)

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of flour? ($0.30)

What other grain products did you use? (Cornmeal)

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? (Yes)

For did you grind it? (With an old-fashioned grinding stone)

Did you purchase flour from a store? (Yes)
3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? ...10 lbs.

What was the price for a ten pound sack of white sugar? ...4.9 cents per lb.

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? ...Peachtree

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? ...30 lbs.

At what price? ...$1.95

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? ...kept

Butter? ...homemade

Eggs? ...kept

What was the price of butter? ...25¢ per lb.

Did you keep eggs for winter? ...yes

Did you make butter? ...yes

What kind of cheese? ...sweet milk cheese from our own cows

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? ...mostly canned pork

How did you get fresh meat? ...purchased as beef in the winter

How often did you get fresh meat? ...occasionally

How did you preserve meat? ...by canning and smoking

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? ...yes

If so what year was it organized? ...1928-1930

Did you use game? ...yes

For how long? ...not sure

What part did fish play in the family diet? ...very little

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? ...cured

Kinds? ...Finnis Haddock

16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

In the past 10 years there has been quite a change in wrappings and containers; instead of things being stored in boxes or drawers in the store... they are all now mostly cartons and cellophane packages.

Which tends to make things fresher & better quality too.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast:
Porridge & milk (mostly boiled)
Eggs, tea & toast
Dinner:
Meaty Potatoes & a vegetable
Buddings (Rice & Bread)
Supper:
Milk
Fried Eggs
Bread & Butter Jam or Syrup. Tea

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? .........1912........ Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

We just had the usual Xmas dinner
Turkey & Plum Pudding. (We raised our own Turkey)
My Father & Mother were here with us, they were
both in their 50s.
My Sister & her husband
my Husband & I. My Sister & her husband
we were all in our 20s to 30s

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

No, we had our own meat, milk, butter
& eggs. We never had any luxuries but
one can get along fine with Plain
foods.
17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest child in your family. Give the year and list the members of the family or siblings.

18. That year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Kansas? Give details. List those present and note their approximate ages at that time.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

We had our own meat, milk, butter, eggs, we never had any burning fuel. We can get along fine with Plains.
